instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that mild water damage but turns on with 0V cpu vcore.

Already replaced <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR>

<RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> are good

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 3.2V

Pin1 of <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> 12.41V

what to try or check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
Do not detect any drop pulse at TONA/B at least?
Check all SPI termination resistors and traces around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>.
You can also try new BIOS.
Can you see if <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> sends out 25MHz at pin 9, or if tries at least?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
No drop voltage at TONA/B. A is steady 1.745v    B is 12.43v

Termination resistors and traces look good around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>

Already tried new bios.

Do not have oscilloscope to measure MHZ but I am getting .7771V from pin 9 of <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
"A is steady 1.745v"
Bad <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> (higher value), or bad <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message: Replaced <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> and replaced <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> twice now and voltage on A starts at 1.886 but continuously drops the longer the machine runs

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message: Also need to mention even though i have .5V at cpu vcore, the cpu is still getting warm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
TONA voltage is completely unusual.
Check all resistors and traces around <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>.
Does it get 5V at pins 19, 29, 46?
3V present at pin 47?
Also check all its MOSFETs; replace them, just in case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
resistors and traces look fine around <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>

5V on pin 19, 29. Only 3.6V on pin 46

3v Present at pin 47

Replaced all mosfets, still same problem

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message: TON A voltage is now 12.46V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
"Only 3.6V on pin 46"
Are you sure?
Check R/<CAPACITOR>C7401</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
Yes I am sure, just checked again. pin 46 3.6V

R/<CAPACITOR>C7401</CAPACITOR> both 3.6 V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
"Check R/<CAPACITOR>C7401</CAPACITOR>."
<RESISTOR>R7401</RESISTOR>=x ohm???
Voltage goes up if remove <CAPACITOR>C7401</CAPACITOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7401</RESISTOR> 10.7

voltage went up to 3.7 after removal of <CAPACITOR>C7401</CAPACITOR> on pin 46

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
Pin46 should have 5V too.
Change <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message: Changed <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> again. I now have 5v on pin 46 and  1.14v at cpu vcore when it first starts up, however I have a quarter fan spin issue now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
Try different RAM module, one at a time, each slot.
VCORE should drop to aprox 0.8V when board works.
Test if board starts in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message: Board somehow lost cpuvcore again since I last tested. Currently have 5V at pin 46 but 0V on cpu vcore again. What to check for this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
cpu vcore is back along with the quarter fan spin.

cpu vcore does drop to .889V before the fan stops spinning

Board starts and stays running while in SMC bypass mode but 0V on cpu vcore while in SMC bypass mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message: Check <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message: R75051 and <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> 12.60V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message: fan spins consistently and cpu vcore stays at 1.1V with no ram.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
Check the exact ohm value for <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52.
Usually <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> increased value causes this problem...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
ohn value was high on <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>, replaced from donar and board booted once with cpu vcore and now not working again after second boot attempt.

What else to check or try?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message:
Which is VCORE value now?
Still 1.1V unchanged?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message: Currently 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no cpu vcore
threads.message: Recheck all the solders you did on CPU power supply area.
